medical_history.chief_complaint: 3 days of intractable nausea and vomiting after eating scallops, associated with epigastric pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to admission with intractable nausea and vomiting after eating scallops, accompanied by chronic waxing and waning bloating and epigastric pain. Previous HIDA scan showed decreased ejection fraction.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Crohn disease, hypothyroidism, GERD, anxiety/depression, iron deficiency anemia, obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), partial bowel obstruction (SBO), varicose veins.
